subject: Sales
title: When to Walk Away
description: One-minute skill: When to Walk Away.

hook.text: A seller kills a huge deal deliberately. The product wasn't right for the buyer. Three referrals followed.

buildup.text: Walking away from a bad-fit deal is the hardest and most valuable skill in professional selling.

discovery.text: Forcing a bad fit breeds cancellations, complaints, and reputation damage that cost far more long term.

twist.text: The paradox: willingness to walk away increases your power. Desperation is a buyer repellent.

climax.text: When the fit is wrong, say so honestly. Trust earned travels much farther than any forced sale.

punchline.text: Walking away from bad deals wins better ones.

quiz.question: Why is walking away from bad-fit deals valuable?
options: It builds trust and generates referrals worth more than the lost deal
